page.title: 05STOCK:STENIGOT-SCAMBLESBY
page.content: { Some forty years ago}the specified lands were used by four Dairy Herds, several herds of Lincoln Red cattle, goodly numbers of fattening cattle and herds of breeding sheep. With the development of agricultural machinery and technical husbandry knowledge,most grassland was put to the plough,so greater arable-crop viability caused livestock to become almost non-existent. { Today:}no Dairy Cows;only one herd of Lincoln Reds producing Pedigree Bulls and Heifers for herd replacement:a few store cattle kept as a sideline by two people,and only one flock of about 100 Cross Bred Ewes grazing some of the low-lying,badly-drained fields,useless for any other purpose. A few store lambs are sometimes brought in to fatten on arable by-products,such as Sugar Beet tops.
